Text: Grrr!!!
Hmmm?

Zeta returns to Shadow Garden HQ after a mission to
hear Delta, one of the Seven Shadows, howling in the
distance.

Jeez, stop making that racket. It's the middle of the
night. What is that dumb dog up to...

(It really is too late for this. I'd better go yell
at her and...)

Zeta walks towards the source of the howling. And
what she finds is...
Woof!

It was a real dog. A real, black dog. It is wagging
its tail eagerly.
Doggo...did you turn into a dog for real now?
I did not!

Zeta spins around, hearing a voice behind her...and
there stands Delta. She is holding shallow dishes of
food and water in her hands.

Aw, too bad. Things'd be quieter around here if you
actually turned into a dog.

Graah! Pussy-cat! Dunno why, but I think ya
made a fool of me just now!
So who's this dog?
Hehe! This's my minion!
Heh...?

I found him when he was wandering lost. And he
thanked me by becoming my minion!

Ohhh, I get it. He's a poor soul who has
an incompetent boss, then.

Ha-haaah. So pussy-cat, are ya jealous that I have
a minion?

What?! I would never... Wait, there's no point in
explaining it. Believe whatever you want, okay?

But that food you're holding has stuff that's bad for
dogs in it. Try not to give your minion food poisoning,
okay?
Graah?!
Humph.

And with a smug snort at the wide-eyed Delta, Zeta
turns to leave. But she immediately stops in her
tracks.
Hmmm?
Woof!

The black dog is blocking Zeta's path. It is sitting
and wagging its tail.
Doggie?
Woof!
What?!

The black dog rolls onto its back and exposes its
belly to Zetacompletely submissive to her.

Hey! What're you doing, boy?! How dare you submit to
the pussy-cat!

Well, well, well...I didn't think there was a dog who
took to cats.

What a smart boy. You defied your species and
determined the correct person you should serve.
Woof!

I don't really like dogs, but if they're smart enough
to come to my side, that's another story.
Good boy, doggie. I'll let you be my minion now.
Woof!
Stop it! That's my minion!

Oh, but a minion has a right to choose his master.
Come, let's go.
Woof!
Grrr...damn pussy-cat! You'll pay for this!

As Delta angrily stomps her feet, Zeta turns and
walks away with a joyful swagger in her stride
and the black dog by her side.

Once out of range of Delta, Zeta crouches down in
front of the black dog.
Okay, doggie, what's your name?

Zeta touches the dog's collar. She'd noticed when she
first saw the dog that it had a collar with a name tag
dangling from it.

Ooh, so your name is "Kuro." Seems like a very apt
name for the Shadow Garden since it means "black."
Makes me feel a real kinship with you.
Woof!

Well, Kuro, thank you for helping me piss off that
stupid dog. Now, let me help you find your real
master.

I don't think you're a strayyou're just lost. You're
well-fed and well-groomed, too. Somebody's been
taking good care of you, huh?
Woof!

Good boy. Okay, let's search the nearby village
tomorrow morning.

And thus, Zeta's quest to find the black dog's owner
begins...
Several days later
Zeta brings Kuro to the village near Shadow Garden HQ.

Okay, Kuro. I hope today's the day we finally find
your master.
Woof!

On the way to the village, Zeta reflects on what had
happened the night before...
Zeta walks through the forest at night, shovel in hand.

After interrogating the thief, I learned his cronies
had hidden the treasure somewhere in this forest.
Eta needs me to retrieve it so she can experiment
on it.

But why did Lady Alpha entrust this task to me?
This's more the dumb dog's specialty... Well, a
mission is a mission.
Woof!
Thanks for helping, buddy. Use that nose of yours.

(If we find the treasure tonight, that's more than I
could ever hope for.)

Zeta's hopes aren't very high as she uses Kuro's
nose to help her search along the ground.

However, for all their digging, they don't find the
treasure. All they find are animal bones, and a
toy someone had buriedall useless junk.
You've got this, Kuro.
Awooo...

Just kidding. This forest is big. I'd be crazy to ask
for that much.
Hm? Kuro, get in those bushes.

Zeta and Kuro hide in the bushes. Torch lights appear
in the distance, along with a number of voices...

Hey, where's the damn marker? It's too dark to see
it...
Ooh! I found it!

(The thief's accomplices... Ah hah, that makes sense.
Lady Alpha must have known this would happen
that's why she entrusted this task to me.)

Zeta counts their presences...there are five of them.
Determining she can take care of them on her own,
she makes her move.

(Yeah, the dumb dog sucks at playing things by ear
like this. Okay...onto goon number one.)

She silently picks off the man carrying the torch.
The area is plunged into darkness.
Wh-What's going on?!
(Goon number two.)

With their vision impaired, Zeta is able to dispose
of the band of thieves in a matter of seconds.

There...all done. Now I just need to retrieve the
treasure and
Woof!
Kuro?

She turns around at the sound of the dog's bark...to
see Kuro wagging his tail and holding a gemstone
in his mouth.
Haha! Mission accomplished.
Zeta gently pats Kuro's head and returns to HQ.

Zeta and Kuro cut through the forest until they
arrive in the small village.
(Well, Kuro is smart and obedient.)

(If we don't find his master, the Shadow Garden could
always take him in.)

(Then we'd give him some combat training and... Oh,
yeah. Maybe we'd need to give him training to sharpen
his senses even more?)
Awooo?
It's nothing, buddy...hmm?

When they arrive at the house that serves as a relay
point for intel-exchange, a boy is standing outside.
(Who's the kid...)

And then the black dog takes off running, heading
straight for the boy...
Woof!
Kuro?!
If you know his name...you must be his owner, then?

Y-Yeah! Thanks for rescuing Kuro! I let him get
away...and I heard...h-he was in this village and
I...! *sniffle*

Don't cry, buddy, you're back together again.
Just don't let him escape again, okay?
I won't!

The black dog licks the boy's face. The boy laughs
through his tears from the dog's ticklish tongue.
(Of course he's happy...he's with his master again.)

Zeta quietly turns to leave. Noticing this, the black
dog takes a step towards her.
Woof!
(Too bad. You would've made a great minion.)

She smiles softly and waves goodbye...as she turns
to return to her own home...
